posts.name: Ofek Harel
posts.cooked: Hey, I’m trying to import our robot’s framework lib and I got into some issues with the new MotorController convention… Where pidWrite() go to? SpeedMotor Once inherited from PID or something like that… I need a method that will be called  before each PID write in any motor controller

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked: Maybe this wrapper class can implement that functionality: PIDMotorController (WPILib API 2022.1.1-rc-1-2-g22c4da1)
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Ofek Harel
posts.cooked: It does not exist for me I downloaded the “2022.1.1-rc-1” version so I could rewrite it as needed before the official release…/

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
But you are getting MotorController ?  I am just asking to make sure you’ve updated the project to 2022.  Sometime their are pains getting everything working.

I haven’t used PIDMotorController but since it is in the api on that rc it should be available to import.  Make sure it is getting imported from pidwrappers I guess.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Noah Andrews
posts.cooked:
Going forwards, the SPARK MAX API has been replaced by REVLib: https://github.com/REVrobotics/REV-Software-Binaries/releases/tag/revlib-2022.0.0

Note that there will be a new version of REVLib coming out within the next couple of days.

posts.name: Tyler Veness
posts.cooked:
OfekHarel:

I’m trying to import our robot’s framework lib and I got into some issues with the new MotorController convention… Where pidWrite() go to?

PIDSource and PIDOutput were deprecated in 2020, and they’ll be removed in 2023. Just call the relevant getter directly and pass it into the PIDController, like so:

ngreen:

Maybe this wrapper class can implement that functionality: PIDMotorController (WPILib API 2022.1.1-rc-1-2-g22c4da1)

Don’t use those. They’ll be deprecated before final release:

Deprecate PIDWrappers, since they use deprecated interfaces wpilibsuite:main ← Beachbot330:DeprecatePIDWrappers opened 03:45PM - 06 Jan 22 UTC sciencewhiz +90 -13

Deprecate PIDWrappers, since they use deprecated interfaces wpilibsuite:main ← Beachbot330:DeprecatePIDWrappers opened 03:45PM - 06 Jan 22 UTC sciencewhiz +90 -13

wpilibsuite:main ← Beachbot330:DeprecatePIDWrappers

opened 03:45PM - 06 Jan 22 UTC sciencewhiz +90 -13

opened 03:45PM - 06 Jan 22 UTC

sciencewhiz

+90 -13

Those wrapper classes are only used by the old command-based vendordep to make RobotBuilder old command-based output easier to implement, and they’ll be removed along with old PIDController and old command-based in 2023. We’re only keeping the old PIDController around because updating old command-based to the new PIDController would be wasted effort.
